main_definition: The act of selecting or making a decision among two or more possibilities, as well as the options themselves available to be selected.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Available alternatives or decisions that one can make in a given situation
meanings_and_examples.example: When it comes to choosing what to eat for dinner, you have several choices: pizza, pasta, or salad.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The power or right of making a decision when faced with different options
meanings_and_examples.example: Giving children the freedom to make their own bedtime choices can help them learn responsibility.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Different possibilities that one has in life, such as career paths or lifestyle decisions
meanings_and_examples.example: At this stage of my life, I have several choices for my future: pursuing a degree, starting a business, or traveling the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A particular selection from a group of options
meanings_and_examples.example: I had to make a choice between going to college and joining the military; it was a difficult decision for me.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act or process of considering different options and making a selection
meanings_and_examples.example: She spent hours weighing her choices before finally deciding on which car to buy.
